Class Line

java.lang.Object
Line
public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
Models a simple line. This class represents a Line object. When combined with the GameArena class, instances of the Line class can be displayed on the screen.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor.

    Determines the size of the arrowhead on this line

    Determines the x-coordinates of the points that form this lines arrowhead.

    Determines the y-coordinates of the points that form this lines arrowhead.

    Obtains the colour of this Line.

    Obtains the layer of this Line.

    Determines the length of this line.

    Obtains the width of this line.

    Obtains the end position of this line on the X axis.

    Obtains the start position of this line on the X axis.

    Obtains the end position of this line on the Y axis.
    double getYStart()
    Obtains the start position of this line on the Y axis.
    void setArrowSize​(double size)
    Defined the size of the arrowhead on this line, as a proportion to the line's width.
    void setLinePosition​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
    Moves the current position of this line to the given X and Y co-ordinates
    void setWidth​(double width)
    Defines the width of this line.

  • Constructor Details

    • Line

      public Line​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double thickness, java.lang.String col, int lay)
      Constructor. Creates a Line with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x co-ordinate of the start of the Line (in pixels)
      y1 - The y co-ordinate of the start of the Line (in pixels)
      x2 - The x co-ordinate of the end of the Line (in pixels)
      y2 - The y co-ordinate of the end of the Line (in pixels)
      thickness - The width of the Line (in pixels)
      col - The colour of the Line (Permissable colours are: BLACK, BLUE, CYAN, DARKGREY, GREY, GREEN, LIGHTGREY, MAGENTA, ORANGE, PINK, RED, WHITE, YELLOW or ##RRGGBB)
      lay - The layer the Line is to be drawn on. Objects with a higher layer number are always drawn on top of those with lower layer numbers.

    • Line

      public Line​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double thickness, java.lang.String col)
      Constructor. Creates a Line with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x co-ordinate of the start of the Line (in pixels)
      y1 - The y co-ordinate of the start of the Line (in pixels)
      x2 - The x co-ordinate of the end of the Line (in pixels)
      y2 - The y co-ordinate of the end of the Line (in pixels)
      thickness - The width of the Line (in pixels)
      col - The colour of the Line (Permissable colours are: BLACK, BLUE, CYAN, DARKGREY, GREY, GREEN, LIGHTGREY, MAGENTA, ORANGE, PINK, RED, WHITE, YELLOW or ##RRGGBB)

    • getXStart

      public double getXStart()
      Obtains the start position of this line on the X axis.
      Returns:
      the X coordinate of the start of this line within the GameArena.

    • setArrowSize

      public void setArrowSize​(double size)
      Defined the size of the arrowhead on this line, as a proportion to the line's width.
      Parameters:
      size - The new size for the arrowhead on this line.

    • getLength

      public double getLength()
      Determines the length of this line.
      Returns:
      the lenght of this line.

    • setLinePosition

      public void setLinePosition​(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Moves the current position of this line to the given X and Y co-ordinates
      Parameters:
      x1 - the new x co-ordinate of the start of this line
      y1 - the new y co-ordinate of the start of this line
      x2 - the new x co-ordinate of the end of this line
      y2 - the new y co-ordinate of the end of this line

    • setWidth

      public void setWidth​(double width)
      Defines the width of this line.
      Parameters:
      width - The new width of this line, in pixels.

    • getWidth

      public double getWidth()
      Obtains the width of this line.
      Returns:
      the width of this line, in pixels.

    • getArrowX

      public int[] getArrowX()
      Determines the x-coordinates of the points that form this lines arrowhead.
      Returns:
